title: Zelenskyy calls for global protests; Biden travels to Europe
body_lines: Ukraine’s President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has called for global protests to demand an end to the Russian invasion.
He has also called for NATO to provide “effective and unrestricted” aid for Ukraine.
Meanwhile, Russian President Vladimir Putin says Moscow plans to sell its gas to “unfriendly countries” in roubles.
US President Joe Biden has landed in Brussels ahead of NATO, G7 and EU summits. He is expected to unveil further sanctions against Russia.
The US says it has determined that Russian forces have committed war crimes in Ukraine. (Al Jazeera)
